Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah bagged two wickets in his first over, clocking an average speed of 137kph.
Jasprit Bumrah took a brace of wickets in a plain over, taking as long as the third ball to hit 140 clicks.
Pre-Game Insights: Jasprit Bumrah led from the front and bagged the Player of the Match award as #TeamIndia win the first #IREvIND T20I by 2 runs via DLS.

Bumrah might have sounded relaxed in the pre-match press conference, but deep inside, his mind might have been tossing like the waves of an ocean, restless and anxious to test himself out in a competitive setting, to re-accustom to international cricket.
Post-Match Reflections: Jasprit Bumrah showed signs of promise that he is hovering in the vicinity of his most destructive zone.
Prasidh Krishna, on T20 debut, consistently produced discomfiting bounce and seamed the ball back, while bowling at a few notches below his regular pace.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The most spectacular Jasprit Bumrah moment on his comeback came not with the ball in his hand. But when he leapt like a hurdler over Ravi Bishnoiâ€™s sliding body near the boundary rope.
Bumrah grinned apologetically when he bowled an uncharacteristic half-tracker to Andy Balbirnie, which was pulled for a four.
In the last over, he began with a cutter barrage, all ducking into the right-handed McCarthy. A searing yorker followed, and two nearly-yorkers wrapped up his comeback.
